about.name: Savannah
about.info_text: Savannah is a charming and historic city located in the state of Georgia, USA. Known for its cobblestone streets, historic architecture, and lush parks, Savannah exudes Southern hospitality and is a popular destination for those seeking a taste of the Old South. The city is famous for its oak-lined streets, antebellum mansions, and its vibrant arts and culture scene. Visitors can explore the historic district, enjoy riverfront views, and indulge in Southern cuisine and hospitality.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 147,000
State: Georgia
Time Zone: Eastern Time Zone (UTC-05:00)
Language: English
Currency: US Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: Savannah has a humid subtropical climate, characterized by hot, humid summers and mild winters. It's a great destination for year-round travel, with pleasant weather and occasional coastal breezes.

attractions_card.title: Forsyth Park
attractions_card.description: Forsyth Park is a 30-acre urban park located in the historic district of Savannah. It features walking paths, gardens, fountains, and is home to the iconic Forsyth Fountain.

attractions_card.title: River Street
attractions_card.description: River Street is a historic street along the Savannah River, lined with shops, restaurants, and galleries. It offers stunning views of the river and is a popular spot for strolling.

attractions_card.title: Historic District
attractions_card.description: Savannah's Historic District is known for its well-preserved 18th and 19th-century architecture. It's a beautiful area to explore on foot, with numerous squares, historic homes, and museums.

attractions_card.title: Bonaventure Cemetery
attractions_card.description: The Bonaventure Cemetery is famous for its hauntingly beautiful sculptures, historic graves, and Spanish moss-draped oak trees. It's a must-visit for history and photography enthusiasts.

attractions_card.title: Telfair Museums
attractions_card.description: The Telfair Museums consist of three separate museums, including the Telfair Academy, the Owens-Thomas House, and the Jepson Center. They showcase art, history, and culture.

attractions_card.title: Wormsloe Historic Site
attractions_card.description: The Wormsloe Historic Site is home to a breathtaking oak-lined avenue and the ruins of a colonial estate, providing a glimpse into Savannah's past.

attractions_card.title: Savannah Historic Squares
attractions_card.description: Savannah boasts 22 historic squares, each with its unique charm and history. They are perfect for picnics, relaxation, and taking in the city's ambiance.

attractions_card.title: Savannah Riverboat Cruises
attractions_card.description: Riverboat cruises on the Savannah River offer scenic tours with live entertainment, dining, and historic narrations.

food_card.title: Shrimp and Grits
food_card.description: Shrimp and Grits is a classic Southern dish featuring shrimp served over creamy, buttery grits, often with a flavorful sauce.

food_card.title: Lowcountry Boil
food_card.description: Lowcountry Boil, also known as a shrimp boil, is a one-pot dish that includes shrimp, corn, potatoes, and sausage, seasoned with Old Bay seasoning.

food_card.title: Fried Chicken
food_card.description: Savannah is known for its delicious fried chicken, often served with biscuits, collard greens, and other Southern sides.

food_card.title: Pecan Pie
food_card.description: Pecan Pie is a classic Southern dessert made with pecans, sugar, and butter, served in a flaky pie crust.

food_card.title: Sweet Tea
food_card.description: Sweet tea is a beloved Southern beverage, a refreshing iced tea that's sweetened to perfection.

hotels_card.title: The Grey
hotels_card.description: The Grey is a critically acclaimed restaurant and boutique hotel located in a restored Greyhound bus terminal, known for its innovative Southern cuisine.

hotels_card.title: The Mansion on Forsyth Park
hotels_card.description: The Mansion on Forsyth Park is an elegant hotel featuring luxurious rooms and an on-site art gallery, all within walking distance of Forsyth Park.

hotels_card.title: Andaz Savannah
hotels_card.description: Andaz Savannah offers modern accommodations in the Historic District, with a rooftop bar and easy access to the city's attractions.

hotels_card.title: The Marshall House
hotels_card.description: The Marshall House is a historic hotel known for its unique character and ghostly tales, offering a taste of Savannah's past.

transport_card.title: Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport
transport_card.description: Savannah/Hilton Head International Airport (SAV) provides domestic and international air travel access to Savannah and the surrounding region.

transport_card.title: Trolley Tours
transport_card.description: Trolley tours are a popular way to explore Savannah, offering guided tours of the city's historic district and notable landmarks.

transport_card.title: Bicycle Rentals
transport_card.description: Bicycle rentals are available for those who want to explore the city at their own pace, with bike-friendly paths and streets in Savannah.

transport_card.title: Walkability
transport_card.description: Savannah's historic district is highly walkable, making it easy for visitors to explore the city on foot and enjoy its historic charm.
